quotes: In advance of the 16th National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party in November 2002, some observers of China wondered who would succeed China’s éminence gris in foreign affairs, Politburo member and Vice Premier Qian Qichen, who was obligated to retire.
Qian was credited with having been the principal architect of China’s emergence from diplomatic isolation and disrepute in the wake of the 1989 disturbances and violent crackdown in Tiananmen Square.

His low-key but dignified and professional management of China’s principal foreign relations during the 1990s had won him promotion to the State Council in 1991, to a vice premiership in 1993, and to the Politburo in 1998.

His low-key but dignified and professional management of China’s principal foreign relations during the 1990s had won him promotion to the State Council in 1991, to a vice premiership in 1993, and to the Politburo in 1998.

much of her time has been taken up with her concurrent responsibilities as minister of health, rebuilding China’s public health sector in the aftermath of the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS).

organizations.name: Chinese Communist Party
quotes: In advance of the 16th National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party in November 2002, some observers of China wondered who would succeed China’s éminence gris in foreign affairs, Politburo member and Vice Premier Qian Qichen, who was obligated to retire.

organizations.name: State Council
quotes: His low-key but dignified and professional management of China’s principal foreign relations during the 1990s had won him promotion to the State Council in 1991, to a vice premiership in 1993, and to the Politburo in 1998.

organizations.name: Politburo
quotes: His low-key but dignified and professional management of China’s principal foreign relations during the 1990s had won him promotion to the State Council in 1991, to a vice premiership in 1993, and to the Politburo in 1998.

organizations.name: National People’s Congress
quotes: The current division of responsibility for foreign affairs remains somewhat uncertain, nearly a year after the 10th National People’s Congress set the current government hierarchy.

organizations.name: Central Military Commission
quotes: Jiang Zemin, both as head of the party’s Central Military Commission and as the ranking party elder, retains both an interest and some influence in the foreign policymaking process.

organizations.name: Foreign Affairs Office
quotes: Within the party bureaucracy, Liu Huaqiu remains head of the party’s Foreign Affairs Office, but his powers and responsibilities in that capacity are not well known outside of Zhongnanhai.

roles.title: Vice Premier
quotes: In advance of the 16th National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party in November 2002, some observers of China wondered who would succeed China’s éminence gris in foreign affairs, Politburo member and Vice Premier Qian Qichen, who was obligated to retire.

roles.title: General Secretary and State President
quotes: General Secretary and State President Hu Jintao has taken an active role in foreign affairs, replacing Jiang Zemin in his head-of-state capacity.

roles.title: Premier
quotes: Premier Wen Jiabao, as head of government, also has undertaken several diplomatic missions.

roles.title: head of the party’s Central Military Commission
quotes: Jiang Zemin, both as head of the party’s Central Military Commission and as the ranking party elder, retains both an interest and some influence in the foreign policymaking process.

roles.title: Politburo Standing Committee member
quotes: His former protégé, Politburo Standing Committee member Zeng Qinghong, is also believed to have some responsibility for foreign policy, although the exact nature of his role is not known.

roles.title: head of the party’s Foreign Affairs Office
quotes: Within the party bureaucracy, Liu Huaqiu remains head of the party’s Foreign Affairs Office, but his powers and responsibilities in that capacity are not well known outside of Zhongnanhai.

roles.title: vice premiers
quotes: In the government apparatus, Wu Yi is the only one of the four vice premiers appointed last year who has appreciable foreign affairs experience, but much of her time has been taken up with her concurrent responsibilities as minister of health, rebuilding China’s public health sector in the aftermath of the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS).

roles.title: minister of health
quotes: much of her time has been taken up with her concurrent responsibilities as minister of health, rebuilding China’s public health sector in the aftermath of the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS).
